author: ADD.xyz
title: ADD.xyz's DeFi Mobile Money Bridge
description: APY's of financial products in Africa has dropped from 20% to 2% APY in the past 5 years due to deflation, political corruption and covid-19

assessments.note: This project would help bring access to ADA to Africa.

The proposal aims to integrate Mobile Money with Defi for enabling lending and other Defi activity in Africa. This proposal can open a large population with smartphones to reap the benefits of DeFi. There is a scope for utilizing DeFi in the underdeveloped sector enabling microfinancing and other related activity. It is also better to have more than one project in this space to increase the reliability of delivery.

My stance is neutral, because the general idea of implementing defy in Africa on an ACTIVE network platform is adressing this challenge, but I disagree because after reading through the proposal, a lot is written about general viewpoints on situation in Africa, but no factual remarks about how would this project help mitigate these to make a stance for the proposal. The add.xyz web page is not functional. I was not able to address the Developer Team because the hyperlinks on the webpage are non existant, I could not open 'About US', and any other link on the page.

Cardano is praised in proposal but the prototype does not contain any Cardano related items. Doing some Cardano-specific tasks are mentioned but not in much detail. Connecting Mobile-Money to the Defi-World has huge potential and it would make Crypto Currencies easier accessible to a lot of people in africa. With the current information, I don't see how the ADD.xyz's DeFi Mobile Money Bridge would help to establish Cardano as the best public block-chain operating in Africa but just beeing a part in the proposal is already a great thing.

It is unclear if the proposers have the capability to deliver on this project. ADD.xyz is still in beta. The majority of the text in the proposal doesn't really cover their capability or development plan.

The proof of concept seams reasonable but I cannot really judge if it is legit and it is only a UI. The Budget does not add up. The Team asks for 85k and wants to buy 35k x2, 20k x2, 15k and 10k from it..
The Plan to hire experienced Plutus Devs seams to be doomed since those do not really exist in large numbers.

The proposer has founded ADD.xyz only in 2019 and limited experience in large software development projects. The proposal will largely depend on fortmatic for security and freshly hired developers for relalissing the project.

I cannot aggree with this statement because there were many inconsistancies with the statements in the proposal. Stating that add.xyz in August 2020 has secured an integration and operating partnerships with major banking providers in Kenya and Nigeria though there are no proof of this to find in the proposal nor on the add webpage. Further stating that Research of Q3 2020 for defi lending into Africa via mobíle Credits is complete yet no links or proofs of this research is provided. After reading all of the proposal I cannot make a picture how would this team make this happen so I must disagree, there are no concrete concepts provided in this proposal, only reading about general situation in africa and how defi would be accepted in the countries mentioned.

The description of the desired solution and the concepts that are used is very detailed. A big team is mentioned in the experience section, but no references are provided. But the linked website and already available prototype is very convincing.
One star reduction because the website states, that in July 2019 a $500k seed round was closed and in Jul 2020 a $1m token sale was completed. This is a lot of money and the provided results seems rather low.
More detail should be proved on what they currently have and the road map for what is being developed to enable feasibility to be assesed.

The proposal gives a lot of Information but do not feel empowered to answer how likely it is to succeed with the plan. It depends a lot on hiring good devs but those will be hard to get. 
The effectiveness to the challenge is pretty clear and it is obvious that the proposers know the system they want to innovate with this proposal.
The proposal needs a technical roadmap and a feasibility study prepared by people with experience in blockchain development and some Cardano development experience.

Strongly disagree, after all stated above, this proposal needs more development and polish. Parts of the writing are dificult to understand, please try to go through your proposal with another person, there are few spelling errors, like "...Africa is a content...". No concrete solution is provided.

The budget is broken down in 4 parts. 3 parts are costs for developers and one part is the cost for marketing. What tasks will be done by them ist not really provided, at least not in a way that would allow to audit the progress. No KPIs or criteria of success is provided. There is a lot of general information regarding the proposal and the concepts that are used but very limited information that can be used to audit and progress the success of the proposal. There is potential for it. Numbers are provided regarding the people that use Mobile Money and a certain percentage of the might use the Money Bridge. This sounds like a pretty good KPI.

solution: We propose to build the first ever MTN/Mobile Money Bridge to DeFi in Nigeria/Kenya using Mobile Merchant On-ramps and lending protocols.
experience:
Arnie Hill - Founder/CEO of ADD.xyx + ADD.xyz's 12 F/T Devs + 4 F/T Non Dev
